meanings.definition: The state or quality of being temporary.
meanings.sent1: The temporarinesses of the snowflake made it melt quickly.
meanings.sent2: I appreciate the temporarinesses of summer, knowing it will eventually end.
meanings.sent3: The temporarinesses of the situation made us laugh at how fleeting it was.
meanings.sent4: Her smile was like the temporarinesses of a shooting star, bright but short-lived.
meanings.sent5: The temporarinesses of childhood is a reminder to cherish every moment.

meanings.definition: The temporary nature or condition of something.
meanings.sent1: We must accept the temporarinesses of life's ups and downs.
meanings.sent2: The temporarinesses of the exhibit meant we had to see it before it closed.
meanings.sent3: The temporarinesses of the cake's sweetness was evident as it quickly disappeared.
meanings.sent4: His love for her was like the temporarinesses of a rainbow after a storm.
meanings.sent5: The temporarinesses of the flowers blooming in spring is a beautiful sight.
